sen.j: 茂山 千五郎（しげやま せんごろう）は、狂言大蔵流の名跡で茂山千五郎家の当主名。
sen.e: Sengoro SHIGEYAMA is a family name of Kyogen Okura-ryu (comic actors of Okura school) and the name head of the Sengoro Shigeyama family.
Sengoro SHIGEYAMA is a family name of Kyogen Okura-ryu (comic actors of Okura school) and the name of the head of the Sengoro Shigeyama family.
sen.cmt: the name head→the name of the headとしました。
sen.e: Sengoro SHIGEYAMA is a family name of Kyogen Okura-ryu (comic actors of Okura school) and the name of the head of the Sengoro Shigeyama family.

sen.j: 茂山家は江戸時代初期から京都で狂言師として活動してきた家であり、九世より当主名が「千五郎」となる。
sen.e: The Shigeyama family has been performing as kyogen performs in Kyoto since the early Edo era and from the Kuse (ninth generation on), the name of the leader has been 'Sengoro.'
The Shigeyama family has been performing kyogen in Kyoto since the early Edo period and from the ninth generation, the name of the leader has been 'Sengoro.'
sen.cmt: performing as kyogen performs→performing kyogen、Edo era→Edo period、the Kuse (ninth generation on)→the ninth generationとしました。
sen.e: The Shigeyama family has been performing kyogen in Kyoto since the early Edo period and from the ninth generation, the name of the leader has been 'Sengoro.'

sen.j: 当代は十三世。
sen.e: The current leader is the thirteenth.
The current leader is the thirteenth.
The current leader is the thirteenth.

sen.j: 九世
sen.e: Kuse
The Ninth
The Ninth

sen.j: 九世茂山千五郎正虎（文化 (日本)7年5月17日 (旧暦)（1810年6月18日）－明治19年（1886年）5月11日）は、江戸時代後期から明治時代初期の狂言師。
sen.e: Sengoro SHIGEYAMA the 9th, Masatora (June 18, 1810-May 11, 1886) was a Kyogen performer in the late Edo era and the early Meji era.
Sengoro SHIGEYAMA the Ninth, Masatora (June 18, 1810-May 11, 1886) was a Kyogen performer in the late Edo period and the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: the 9th→the Ninth、Meijiのスペルミス修正、era→perodとしました。
sen.e: Sengoro SHIGEYAMA the Ninth, Masatora (June 18, 1810-May 11, 1886) was a Kyogen performer in the late Edo period and the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 別名千吾・茂山千作初世。
sen.e: He was also known as Sengo, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA the first.
He was also known as Sengo, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA the First.
He was also known as Sengo, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA the First.

sen.j: 京都の呉服商佐々木甚兵衛浄喜の子として生まれ、初めは忠三郎と名乗った。
sen.e: Sengoro was born as a child of 佐々木甚兵衛浄喜, kimono fabrics dealer, and was first called Chuzaburo.
sen.cmt: ｢佐々木甚兵衛浄喜｣の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Sengoro was born as a child of 佐々木甚兵衛浄喜, kimono fabrics dealer, and was first called Chuzaburo.
Sengoro was born as a child of 佐々木甚兵衛浄喜, kimono fabrics dealer, and was first called Chuzaburo.

sen.j: 8歳で茂山久蔵英政に入門し、3年後にはその養子となる。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Kyuzo Hidemasa SHIGEYAMA at the age of eight and was adopted three years later.
He became a disciple of Kyuzo Hidemasa SHIGEYAMA at the age of eight and was adopted three years later.
He became a disciple of Kyuzo Hidemasa SHIGEYAMA at the age of eight and was adopted three years later.

sen.j: 文政4年（1821年）、禁裏に召されて御用を務める。
sen.e: He was summoned at Imperial Palace in 1821 and performed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was summoned at Imperial Palace in 1821 and performed.
He was summoned at Imperial Palace in 1821 and performed.

sen.j: が、この年養父が死去。
sen.e: In the same year, when his foster father passed away, it was doubtful that 12-year-old Sengoro could succeed to the Shigeyama family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the same year, however, his foster father passed away.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」however追加、一部訳文修正
sen.e: In the same year, however, his foster father passed away.

sen.j: 12歳の千五郎には茂山家継承は無理と思われた。
sen.e: It was doubtful that 12-year-old Sengoro could succeed to the Shigeyama family.
It was doubtful that 12-year-old Sengoro could succeed to the Shigeyama family.

sen.j: だが、千五郎は本家筋に当たる江戸の大蔵流家元を頼って修業を重ねる。
sen.e: Sengoro, under the guardianship of the iemoto, or the head of the Okura Family in Edo, who ｗas in the direct lineage, kept on training.
Sengoro, under the guardianship of the iemoto, or the head of the Okura school in Edo, who ｗas in the direct lineage, kept on training.
Sengoro, under the guardianship of the iemoto, or the head of the Okura school in Edo, who ｗas in the direct lineage, kept on training.

sen.j: 16歳の時、家元より茂山家再興を命じられて京都に戻る。
sen.e: At the age of 16, Sengoro returned to Kyoto on command of the iemoto to revive the Shigeyama family.
At the age of 16, Sengoro returned to Kyoto on command of the iemoto to revive the Shigeyama family.
At the age of 16, Sengoro returned to Kyoto on command of the iemoto to revive the Shigeyama family.

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）に彦根藩の御用となる。
sen.e: He became an official business of the Hikone clan in 1837.
He became an official business of the Hikone clan in 1837.
He became an official business of the Hikone clan in 1837.

sen.j: 後に同藩の藩主となった井伊直弼に重んじられた。
sen.e: He was treated as an important person by Naosuke II who later became the lord of the same clan.
He was treated as an important person by Naosuke II who later became the lord of the same clan.
He was treated as an important person by Naosuke II who later became the lord of the same clan.

sen.j: また、禁裏御用にも復帰して茂山家の再興を果たす。
sen.e: He also returned to the official business of the Imperial Palace and thus successfully revived the Shigeyama family.
He also returned to the official business of the Imperial Palace and thus successfully revived the Shigeyama family.
He also returned to the official business of the Imperial Palace and thus successfully revived the Shigeyama family.

sen.j: 明治維新以後の混乱期にも京都の伝統的な狂言を守り続けた。
sen.e: Even during the chaotic period after the Meiji Restoration, he worked hard to protect traditional kyogen performance in Kyoto.
Even during the chaotic period after the Meiji Restoration, he worked hard to protect traditional kyogen performance in Kyoto.
Even during the chaotic period after the Meiji Restoration, he worked hard to protect traditional kyogen performance in Kyoto.

sen.j: 十世
sen.e: 10th
The 10th
The 10th

sen.j: 十世茂山千五郎正重（元治元年9月27日 (旧暦)（1864年10月27日） - 昭和25年（1950年）2月5日）。
sen.e: Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10th (October 27, 1864-February 5, 1950)
Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10th (October 27, 1864-February 5, 1950)
Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10th (October 27, 1864-February 5, 1950)

sen.j: 九世の三男。
sen.e: Third son of the 9th
Third son of the Ninth.
sen.cmt: the Ninthとし、ピリオド追加
sen.e: Third son of the Ninth.

sen.j: 本名市蔵。
sen.e: His real name was Ichizo.
His real name was Ichizo.
His real name was Ichizo.

sen.j: 1888年、十世茂山千五郎正重を襲名、1946年、茂山千作2世を襲名。
sen.e: In 1888, he succeeded the name Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10 and in 1946, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the 2nd.
In 1888, he succeeded to the name Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10th and in 1946, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the Second.
sen.cmt: succeeded the name→suceeded to the name、the 10→the 10th、the 2nd→the Secondとしました。
sen.e: In 1888, he succeeded to the name Sengoro Masashige SHIGEYAMA, the 10th and in 1946, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the Second.

sen.j: 十一世
sen.e: 11th
The 11th
The 11th

sen.j: 本名真一（まさかず）。
sen.e: His real name was Masakazu.
His real name was Masakazu.
His real name was Masakazu.

sen.j: 1946年、十一世茂山千五郎を襲名、1966年、茂山千作3世を襲名。
sen.e: In 1946, he succeeded the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 11th and in 1966, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the 3rd.
In 1946, he succeeded to the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 11th and in 1966, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the Third.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、succeeded the name→suceeded to the name、the 3rd→the Thirdとしました。
sen.e: In 1946, he succeeded to the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 11th and in 1966, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the Third.

sen.j: 1976年に重要無形文化財各個指定（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1976.
He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1976.
He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1976.

sen.e: 12th

sen.e: First son of the 11th
First son of the 11th.

sen.j: 本名七五三（しめ）。
sen.e: His real name is Shime.
His real name is Shime.
His real name is Shime.

sen.j: 1966年、十二世茂山千五郎を襲名、1994年、茂山千作4世を襲名。
sen.e: In 1966, he succeeded the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 12th and in 1994, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the 4rd.

sen.cmt: 4rd→Fourthに修正、余分なスペース消去、succeeded the name→suceeded to the nameとしました。
sen.e: In 1966, he succeeded to the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 12th and in 1994, Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the Fourth.

sen.j: 1989年に重要無形文化財各個指定（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1989.
He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1989.
He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1989.

sen.e: First son of the 12th.

sen.j: 本名正義（まさよし）。
sen.e: His real name is Masayoshi.

In 1994, he succeeded the name Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 13th.

sen.j: 当代。
sen.e: He serves as the present head of the family.
